summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It includes an official statement from the Attorney General's office announcing Epstein's apparent suicide in federal custody and ordering an investigation, as well as internal emails coordinating the response and confirming the FBI's involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old inmate found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide while awaiting trial for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain, asking if the Attorney General plans to issue a statement and inquiring if the FBI is on scene following Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. Life-saving measures were initiated, he was transported to a hospital, and was subsequently pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein Arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: AG Orders Investigation into Epstein's Death
events.description: The Attorney General orders a full, thorough, and independent investigation into the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m., from an apparent suicide.
Epstein was in federal custody awaiting trial after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, having arrived at MCC on July 6, 2019.
The Attorney General ordered a full, thorough, and independent investigation into the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The FBI was investigating the incident at the time of the correspondence.
